Not Matt's Scripts

What are Matt's scripts?

Matt's Script Archive has been on the web since 1995. It is a repository of CGI scripts written in Perl by a programmer called Matt Wright.

MSA is probably the most popular repository of CGI scripts currently available on the internet.

Why is this "Not Matt's Scripts"?

The problem is that Matt is not exactly the world's best Perl programmer. His scripts are well known amongst the community to be badly written, buggy and insecure. Anyone asking for support on Matt's scripts in any forum will be told in no uncertain terms that they shouldn't use his scripts.

Unfortunately until now there have been no replacements for Matt's scripts that you would want people to use. Some months ago, the London Perl Mongers decided to address this problem and write a series of drop-in replacements for Matt's scripts. This project is still on-going, but in meantime I've decided that it's worth actually getting some code out there that people can use. Hence this page.

So what is "Not Matt's Scripts"

This is very much a "work in progress" I welcome comments, enhancements and bug fixes to the scripts here. Also if you have a drop-in replacement for one of Matt's scripts that isn't here yet, I'd be happy to add it to my list.

For all enquiries, comments or offers of help, please contact me at nms@dave.org.uk.

Please note that these scripts are intended to replace Matt's scripts. This means that their target audience is people who might not know very much at all about Perl. Any contributed scripts must therefore follow certain rules:

  • They must run under Perl 5.004_04 or later. Any earlier Perl than this is pre-historic and can therefore be safely ignored.
  • They must not use any non-standard Perl modules. I know this is a bit contentious, but I really think that the target audience will have problems installing modules from CPAN.
  • They must run with no errors or warnings under use strict and -wT. One of the worst legacies of Matt's scripts is that people use them to learn Perl. And Matt is a complete stranger to programming under these contraints. If people learn Perl from NMS they will at least learn better programming habits.

So what's here?

Did I mention this was a work in progress? Here are the scripts that are currently available. Others will follow in the next few weeks.

Note: Most of the docs included with the scripts is a bit rough and ready and could use some tidying up. If you'd like to help, please get in touch with me.

ScriptDescription
Countdown Count down the time to a certain date
Guestbook A simple guest book script
Random Image Display a random image
Random Links Display a random link
Random Text Display a randomly chosen piece of text
Simple Search Simple web site search engine
SSI Random Image Display a random image using SSI
Text Clock Display the time
Text Counter Text counter
